snippet: Researchers have found that prolonged droughts and soil overuse may have led to the decline of the ancient city of Angkor.
abstract: Study published by Mary Beth Day in The Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences finds that prolonged droughts and overuse of soil may have interfered with water management in the ancient Cambodian city of Angkor; trend may have led to decline of the Khmer empire that flourished from the 9th to the 15th century.
lead_paragraph: Researchers have found that prolonged droughts and soil overuse may have led to the decline of the ancient city of Angkor.

headline.print_headline: Ancient Capital Wilted When Water Ran Low
headline.seo: Angkor, Seat of the Khmer Empire, Wilted When Water Ran Low
headline.main: Ancient Capital Wilted When Water Ran Low

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
